intro: Aeranthes intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate air plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, which includes many epiphytic plants that grow on other plants without being parasitic. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that collect water and nutrients, and it produces small, colorful flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. Aeranthes intermedia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
